hints.label: lem-adaptive-force-bounded
hints.title: N-Uniform Bounded Perturbation from Adaptive Force
hints.content:
1233: :label: lem-adaptive-force-bounded
1234: 
1235: The adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ contributes a bounded perturbation to the drift of $V_{\text{total}}$. There exists a **ρ-dependent but N-uniform constant** $K_F(\rho) < \infty$ such that:
1236: 
1237: $$
1238: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}(S), \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(S) \right\rangle \right| \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1)
1239: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1230: ### 6.2. Boundedness of the Adaptive Force Contribution
1231: 
1232: :::{prf:lemma} N-Uniform Bounded Perturbation from Adaptive Force
1233: :label: lem-adaptive-force-bounded
1234: 
1235: The adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ contributes a bounded perturbation to the drift of $V_{\text{total}}$. There exists a **ρ-dependent but N-uniform constant** $K_F(\rho) < \infty$ such that:
1236: 
1237: $$
1238: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}(S), \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(S) \right\rangle \right| \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1)
1239: $$
1240:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-34
hints.content:
1243: 
1244: :::{prf:proof}
1245: By the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality:
1246: 
1247: $$
1248: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}, \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} \right\rangle \right| \le \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\| \cdot \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\|
1249: $$
1250: 
1251: **Step 1: N-Uniform Bound on $\|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\|$.** By **Appendix A, Theorem A.1** (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity`), the C¹ regularity of the ρ-localized fitness potential establishes that:
1252: 
1253: $$
1254: \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(S)\| = \epsilon_F \|\nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](S)\| \le \epsilon_F F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)
1255: $$
1256: 
1257: where $F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) = O(1/\rho)$ is the **N-uniform** explicit bound derived in the appendix through rigorous chain rule analysis and the telescoping property of normalized localization weights.
1258: 
1259: **Step 2: Polynomial growth of $\|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\|$.** The Lyapunov function is:
1260: 
1261: $$
1262: V_{\text{total}}(S) = \alpha_x V_{\text{Var},x} + \alpha_v V_{\text{Var},v} + \alpha_D V_{\text{Mean},D} + \alpha_R V_{\text{Mean},R}
1263: $$
1264: 
1265: Each component is a quadratic or linear function of the particle positions and velocities. For example:
1266: 
1267: $$
1268: V_{\text{Var},x} = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \|x_i - \bar{x}\|^2
1269: $$
1270: 
1271: Its gradient with respect to $x_i$ is:
1272: 
1273: $$
1274: \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{Var},x} = \frac{2}{N} (x_i - \bar{x})
1275: $$
1276: 
1277: Thus:
1278: 
1279: $$
1280: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{Var},x}\| \le \frac{2}{N} \|x_i - \bar{x}\| \le \frac{2}{\sqrt{N}} \sqrt{V_{\text{Var},x}}
1281: $$
1282: 
1283: Summing over all particles and components:
1284: 
1285: $$
1286: \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\|^2 \le C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)
1287: $$
1288: 
1289: for some constant $C_{\nabla}$ depending on the weights $\alpha_x, \alpha_v, \alpha_D, \alpha_R$.
1290: 
1291: **Step 3: Combine.** Therefore:
1292: 
1293: $$
1294: \left| \left\langle \nabla V_{\text{total}}, \, \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} \right\rangle \right| \le \sqrt{C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)} \cdot \epsilon_F F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}} + 1)
1295: $$

hints.label: lem-viscous-dissipative
hints.title: Dissipative Contribution from Viscous Force
hints.content:
1318: :label: lem-viscous-dissipative
1319: 
1320: The normalized viscous force
1321: 
1322: $$
1323: \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}} = \nu \sum_{j \neq i} \frac{K(x_i - x_j)}{\deg(i)} (v_j - v_i)
1324: $$
1325: 
1326: contributes a **negative** (dissipative) term to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{Var},v}$:
1327: 
1328: $$
1329: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\nu \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) \le 0
1330: $$
1331: 
1332: where
1333: 
1334: $$
1335: \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) := \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \ge 0
1336: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1315: ### 6.3. Dissipativity of the Viscous Force
1316: 
1317: :::{prf:lemma} Dissipative Contribution from Viscous Force
1318: :label: lem-viscous-dissipative
1319: 
1320: The normalized viscous force
1321: 
1322: $$
1323: \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}} = \nu \sum_{j \neq i} \frac{K(x_i - x_j)}{\deg(i)} (v_j - v_i)
1324: $$
1325: 
1326: contributes a **negative** (dissipative) term to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{Var},v}$:
1327: 
1328: $$
1329: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\nu \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) \le 0
1330: $$
1331: 
1332: where
1333: 
1334: $$
1335: \mathcal{D}_{\text{visc}}(S) := \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \ge 0
1336: $$
1337:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-131
hints.content:
1340: 
1341: :::{prf:proof}
1342: The velocity variance is:
1343: 
1344: $$
1345: V_{\text{Var},v} = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2
1346: $$
1347: 
1348: From the Stratonovich chain rule (Theorem [](#thm-strat-chain)), the contribution of the normalized viscous force to the drift is:
1349: 
1350: $$
1351: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = \sum_{i=1}^N \left\langle \nabla_{v_i} V_{\text{Var},v}, \, \nu \sum_{j \neq i} \frac{K(x_i - x_j)}{\deg(i)} (v_j - v_i) \right\rangle
1352: $$
1353: 
1354: Since $\nabla_{v_i} V_{\text{Var},v} = \frac{2}{N}(v_i - \bar{v})$:
1355: 
1356: $$
1357: \begin{aligned}
1358: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) &= \frac{2\nu}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \frac{1}{\deg(i)} \sum_{j \neq i} K(x_i - x_j) \langle v_i - \bar{v}, \, v_j - v_i \rangle
1359: \end{aligned}
1360: $$
1361: 
1362: **Key observation:** We use the **antisymmetric pairing structure** of $(v_j - v_i)$.
1363: 
1364: Define the symmetric weight matrix $W_{ij} = K(x_i - x_j)$. Since the sum over all pairs can be symmetrized:
1365: 
1366: $$
1367: \begin{aligned}
1368: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) &= \frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} W_{ij} \left[ \frac{\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle}{\deg(i)} + \frac{\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_i - v_j \rangle}{\deg(j)} \right]
1369: \end{aligned}
1370: $$
1371: 
1372: Using $\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_i - v_j \rangle = -\langle v_j - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle$:
1373: 
1374: $$
1375: = \frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} W_{ij} \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} - \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle
1376: $$
1377: 
1378: Expanding $\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - v_i \rangle = -\|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2 + \langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - \bar{v} \rangle$ and using the identity $\|v_i - v_j\|^2 = \|v_i - \bar{v}\|^2 + \|v_j - \bar{v}\|^2 - 2\langle v_i - \bar{v}, v_j - \bar{v} \rangle$, we obtain after algebraic manipulation:
1379: 
1380: $$
1381: A_{\text{viscous}}(V_{\text{Var},v}) = -\frac{\nu}{N} \sum_{i < j} K(x_i - x_j) \left[ \frac{1}{\deg(i)} + \frac{1}{\deg(j)} \right] \|v_i - v_j\|^2 \le 0
1382: $$

hints.label: lem-diffusion-bounded
hints.title: Bounded Change from Adaptive Diffusion
hints.content:
1396: :label: lem-diffusion-bounded
1397: 
1398: Replacing the constant diffusion $\sigma I$ with the adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x, S)$ results in a bounded change to the drift. The diffusion contribution $A_{\text{diff}}(S)$ from Definition [](#def-strat-drift) satisfies:
1399: 
1400: $$
1401: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff}} < \infty
1402: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1393: ### 6.4. Boundedness of the Diffusion Perturbation
1394: 
1395: :::{prf:lemma} Bounded Change from Adaptive Diffusion
1396: :label: lem-diffusion-bounded
1397: 
1398: Replacing the constant diffusion $\sigma I$ with the adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x, S)$ results in a bounded change to the drift. The diffusion contribution $A_{\text{diff}}(S)$ from Definition [](#def-strat-drift) satisfies:
1399: 
1400: $$
1401: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff}} < \infty
1402: $$
1403:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-197
hints.content:
1406: 
1407: :::{prf:proof}
1408: Recall from Definition [](#def-strat-drift):
1409: 
1410: $$
1411: A_{\text{diff}}(S) = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^d \left[ (\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V) - \sigma^2 \|\nabla_{v_i} V\|^2 \right]
1412: $$
1413: 
1414: where $\sigma_{ij}^{\text{reg}}$ is the $j$-th column of $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$.
1415: 
1416: **Step 1: Bound the Stratonovich second-order term.** The term $(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V)$ is a directional second derivative. By the chain rule:
1417: 
1418: $$
1419: (\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V) = \langle \sigma_{ij}, \nabla^2_{v_i} V \sigma_{ij} \rangle + \langle \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \sigma_{ij}, \nabla_{v_i} V \rangle
1420: $$
1421: 
1422: The first term is bounded using the Hessian of $V$:
1423: 
1424: $$
1425: \left| \langle \sigma_{ij}, \nabla^2_{v_i} V \sigma_{ij} \rangle \right| \le \|\sigma_{ij}\|^2 \|\nabla^2_{v_i} V\| \le c_{\max} \|\nabla^2 V\|
1426: $$
1427: 
1428: by Theorem [](#thm-ueph).
1429: 
1430: The second term involves the derivative of the diffusion coefficient. Since $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}$ has bounded derivatives (it's a smooth function of the uniformly bounded $H(S)$), there exists $L_\Sigma < \infty$ such that:
1431: 
1432: $$
1433: \left| \langle \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \sigma_{ij}, \nabla_{v_i} V \rangle \right| \le L_\Sigma \|\nabla V\|
1434: $$
1435: 
1436: **Step 2: Bound the backbone term.** For the backbone diffusion $\sigma I$:
1437: 
1438: $$
1439: \sigma^2 \|\nabla_{v_i} V\|^2 \le \sigma^2 \|\nabla V\|^2
1440: $$
1441: 
1442: **Step 3: Combine.** Since $V_{\text{total}}$ is a quadratic-like function with bounded second derivatives:
1443: 
1444: $$
1445: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{total}}\| \le C_{\nabla\nabla}, \quad \|\nabla V_{\text{total}}\| \le C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)^{1/2}
1446: $$
1447: 
1448: Therefore:
1449: 
1450: $$
1451: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le \frac{N d}{2} \left( c_{\max} C_{\nabla\nabla} + L_\Sigma C_{\nabla} (V_{\text{total}} + 1)^{1/2} + \sigma^2 C_{\nabla}^2 (V_{\text{total}} + 1) \right)
1452: $$
1453: 
1454: For the perturbation analysis, we can bound this by:
1455: 
1456: $$
1457: |A_{\text{diff}}(S)| \le C_{\text{diff,0}} + C_{\text{diff,1}} V_{\text{total}}
1458: $$

hints.label: cor-total-perturbation
hints.title: Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
hints.content:
1474: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1475: 
1476: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1477: 
1478: $$
1479: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1480: $$
1481: 
1482: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1483: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1484: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1485: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1486: 
1487: Combining these and absorbing constants:
1488: 
1489: $$
1490: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S) + (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho))
1491: $$
1492: 
1493: **ρ-Dependence Interpretation:**
1494: - All perturbation bounds depend on ρ through the localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1495: - For any fixed ρ > 0, all bounds are finite
hints.raw_directive:
1471: Combining the three lemmas, we obtain the total perturbation bound:
1472: 
1473: :::{prf:corollary} Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
1474: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1475: 
1476: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1477: 
1478: $$
1479: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1480: $$
1481: 
1482: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1483: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1484: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1485: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1486: 
1487: Combining these and absorbing constants:
1488: 
1489: $$
1490: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S) + (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho))
1491: $$
1492: 
1493: **ρ-Dependence Interpretation:**
1494: - All perturbation bounds depend on ρ through the localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1495: - For any fixed ρ > 0, all bounds are finite
1496: - As ρ → ∞, the bounds recover those of the global backbone model
